title: Quiz 1: Fundamentals of Education & Nursing History
description: Assess your understanding of the history of education in Kenya, the evolution of nursing training, and core principles of learning.

questions.question: Which commission was set up in 1964, shortly after Kenya's independence, to improve education and fight ignorance, disease, and poverty?
questions.explanation: The Ominde Report (1964) was the first education commission after independence, aimed at reforming the colonial education system to meet the needs of independent Kenya.
questions.hint: It shares a name with a famous Kenyan academic.

questions.question: The art and science of helping adults learn is called ___BLANK___, while the art of helping children learn is called ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Andragogy focuses on adult learning principles (self-directed), while Pedagogy focuses on child learning (teacher-directed).

questions.question: Arrange the following nursing qualifications in the chronological order of their establishment in Kenya:
questions.hint: Dressers were the earliest form of training.

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized ingredients that potentiate a learning situation?
questions.explanation: The four key ingredients are Motivation, Information, Practice, and Feedback (MIPF).

questions.question: Learning is defined as a directly observable physical change in the learner.
questions.explanation: Learning is abstract and not directly observable; it is inferred from a change in behavior or performance.
questions.hint: Can you 'see' the process of learning happening inside the brain?

questions.question: Match the nursing qualification to its year of introduction:
What is the term for a learning environment that recognizes the right to make mistakes and tolerates imperfection?
questions.explanation: A conducive or enhancing environment fosters learning by reducing anxiety and encouraging experimentation.

questions.question: Which principle states that learning evolves from competence through repetition?
questions.explanation: Practice and Repetition lead to competence ('practice makes perfect').

questions.question: According to Carl Rogers, which of the following statements about learning are TRUE?

options.text: Humans have a natural potential to learn
Significant learning is acquired through doing
Learning must be forced by the teacher
Learning involves the whole person (feelings and intellect)

questions.explanation: Rogers emphasized self-initiated, experiential, and holistic learning.

questions.question: In the 'Systematic Approach' to learning, instruction should proceed from the unknown to the known.
questions.explanation: It should proceed from the KNOWN to the UNKNOWN, building on existing knowledge.
questions.hint: Do you start with what they don't know?
